alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Monroe; Northern Cayuga; Ontario; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:17AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Drenching Thunderstorms Expected Through 3 AM... Moderately heavy showers and thunderstorms with tropical downpours will impact the Genesee valley and Finger Lakes region through 3 AM EDT. While basin average rainfall will be in the vicinity of one half inch...localized amounts of an inch to an inch and a half in 60 minutes will be possible. This could produce significant ponding on area roadways with poor drainage and lowland agricultural flooding possible. The heaviest precipitation will exit the Genesee valley by 2:00 AM EDT and will be out of the Finger Lakes region by 3:30 AM. The movement of the individual showers and thunderstorms is to the north at generally 25 to 30 mph. Remember not to drive across flooded roadways at night...as the depth of the water may be too great to safely pass. It is also possible that flooded roadways may be washed away under flowing water.
